text:
Nitro

Look - Off white creamy head. Lighter brown body. A lot of head.

Smell - Coffee. Malt. Bubblegum.

Taste - Bitter coffee. Vanilla. Bubblegum. Malt. Light hop.

Feel - Very smooth. Creamy.

Overall - Coffee and nitro make gnarly great. MadTree is great with coffee and vanilla.

On tap at Giant Eagle in Grandview w/ Deeper Roots Coffee: clearish brown pour, light tan head. aroma of vanilla, coffee, roasty. tastes are nutty, coffee and light vanilla (good by me). big coffee fan - so this works for me.

2/23/2016: Aroma much like that of a vanilla latte; Brown in color, dense tan head; Creamed coffee, roasted coffee beans, earthy/herbal hoppy finish and some bitterness; Medium body, ultra smooth and creamy; Pretty solid, but the coffee seems to dominate the base beer; gets better as it breathes, but still mostly coffee. Draught (nitro) at Madtree Brewing Company in Cincinnati, Ohio.

5oz nitro sample at 101 Beer Kitchen Gahanna on 2/17/16. Pours clear brown with a thick tan nitro head. Aroma of roasty coffee, caramel and creamy vanilla. Creamy vanilla flavor with a bitter coffee finish.

On nitro tap at MadTree. Pours dark brown with a khaki head that leaves spotty lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasty malts, and vanilla. Taste is fresh roast coffee, vanilla, chocolate, toasty malt, caramel, and a surpising bite of bitter hop resin. Medium bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation. Just an excellent all around brown ale! The addition of coffee and vanilla really set it off.

Sample from cask at the Big Tap In on 05/31/2014. Dark brown color with a medium thin light beige head that diminishes steadily. Sticky small patches of lacing. Aroma of roasted coffee, malt and vanilla. Medium-bodied with flavors of chocolate malt, coffee and slight vanilla. The finish is roasty with a vanilla mocha aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Draft to taster dark brown. Nose malt, nutty, and hint of coffee. Taste some malt then definite coffee. Bitter on finish Coffee plays well with underlying flavors. Nice treatment to the base beer.

Draft sample. Pours a brown color with a little bit of amber highlights and a small beige head. Nice, toasty coffee aroma here, with underlying nuts, vanilla, dead leaves, earthy hops, and brown sugar. Coffee adds a nice dimension here. Light-medium bodied, with a toasty mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Good beer.

Taster on tap at the brewery. Mildly hazy brown / red color. Thin khaki head. Leaves good, thicker rows of lace. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. Medium to bigger body. Lightly dry finish. Good coffee flavor, lightly roast, nice lighter vanilla. Hint of chocolate and smoke. Good moderate bitter taste. Very tasty spin on gnarly brown, added ingredients work very well and make a big difference. Great coffee brown ale.

Draft. Poured a clear dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate toasted chocolate malt, coffee and vanilla aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted sweet coffee flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Complex solid beer that exceeded my expectations.

Draft at Madtree. Pours cola brown with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have everything as advertised; coffee, vanilla, some roasted malt quite a bit of character. I like the base brown as much as any brown outthere and this raises it up a notch.

Draft to taster at MadTree. Looks good; a fairly transparent brown with light beige lacing. Smells malty and nutty with notes of coffee and mild vanilla. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth and robust mouthfeel. Good beer.
